subject: Critical Thinking
title: Reductio ad Absurdum: Proof by Explosion
description: A micro-lesson that makes Reductio ad Absurdum: Proof by Explosion usable.

hook.text: Assume the opposite of what you want to prove. If it leads to a contradiction, your original claim wins.

buildup.text: This is reductio ad absurdum ‚Äî reducing an argument to absurdity to disprove it.

discovery.text: Euclid proved there are infinitely many prime numbers this way 2,300 years ago. The proof still stands.

twist.text: It works in everyday arguments too. 'If we never spend money, we'd save everything ‚Äî but we'd starve.'

climax.text: Reductio is the nuclear option of logic ‚Äî it destroys positions by showing they self-destruct.

punchline.text: To defeat an idea, follow it to its logical end.

quiz.question: How does reductio ad absurdum work?
options: By assuming the opposite and reaching a contradiction
